edu.biu.scapi.circuits.garbledCircuit
Class GarbledBooleanCircuitImp

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.circuits.garbledCircuit.GarbledBooleanCircuitImp
All Implemented Interfaces:
GarbledBooleanCircuit
public class GarbledBooleanCircuitImp
extends java.lang.Object
implements GarbledBooleanCircuit

A concrete implementation of GarbledBooleanCircuit that is common for all types of circuits.

It gets an input a object in the constructor that defines which specific type of circuit it really is.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

Constructor Detail

GarbledBooleanCircuitImp

public GarbledBooleanCircuitImp(BooleanCircuit bc)
Default constructor. Sets the given boolean circuit and creates a Free XOR circuit using a AESFixedKeyMultiKeyEncryption.

GarbledBooleanCircuitImp

public GarbledBooleanCircuitImp(GarblingParameters input)
A constructor that gets an input object and creates the circuit with its contents.

This constructor should be used in case the garbling is done using the encryption scheme. In case the user want to garble using a seed, use the constructor that gets a prg.

The created circuit will be "empty", without garbled tables.

After this constructor the circuit is not complete, one of the garble functions should be called in order to fill the garbled tables and translation table.

Parameters:
input - Specifies which concrete type of circuit to implement.

GarbledBooleanCircuitImp

public GarbledBooleanCircuitImp(GarblingParameters input,
                                PseudorandomGenerator prg)
A constructor that gets a prg and an input object and creates the circuit with their contents.

This constructor should be used in case the garbling is done using a seed. In case the user want to garble using an encryption scheme, use the constructor that does not get a prg.

The created circuit will be "empty", without garbled tables.

After this constructor the circuit is not complete, one of the garble functions should be called in order to create the underlying gates.

Parameters:
input - Specifies which concrete type of circuit to implement.

                                                         throws NotAllInputsSetException
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
This method computes the circuit if the input has been set.

It returns a HashMap containing the garbled output. This output can be translated via the GarbledBooleanCircuit.translate(Map) method.

Specified by:
compute in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Returns:
returns a HashMap that maps the index of the output wire to the garbled value of the wire.

internalVerify

public boolean internalVerify(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputWireValues,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allOutputWireValues)
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
This function behaves exactly as the verify(Map allInputWireValues) method except the last part. The verify function verifies that the translation table matches the resulted output garbled values, while this function does not check it but return the resulted output garbled values.

Specified by:
internalVerify in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Parameters:
allInputWireValues - A containing both keys for each input wire. For each input wire index, the map contains an array of two values. The value in the 0 position is the 0 encoding, and the value in the 1 position is the 1 encoding.
allOutputWireValues - A containing both keys for each output wire. When calling the function this map should be empty and will be filled during the process of the function.
Returns:
true if this GarbledBooleanCircuit is a garbling the given keys, false if it is not.

setGarbledTables

public void setGarbledTables(GarbledTablesHolder garbledTables)
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
Sets the garbled tables of this circuit.

This function is useful if we would like to pass many garbled circuits built on the same boolean circuit.

This is a compact way to define a circuit, that is, two garbled circuit with the same multi encryption scheme and the same basic boolean circuit only differ in the garbled tables and the translation table.

Thus we can hold one garbled circuit for all the circuits and only replace the garbled tables (and the translation tables if necessary). The advantage is that the size of the tables only is much smaller that all the information stored in the circuit (gates and other member variables). The size becomes important when sending large circuits.

The receiver of the circuits will set the garbled tables for the relevant circuit.

Specified by:
setGarbledTables in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit

setGarbledInputFromUngarbledInput

public void setGarbledInputFromUngarbledInput(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Byte> ungarbledInput,
                                              java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputWireValues)
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
This method takes a map containing the GarbledWire indices and non garbled value.

This method then performs the lookup on the accompanying allInputWireValues Map and sets the inputs to the corresponding garbled outputs.

Specified by:
setGarbledInputFromUngarbledInput in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Parameters:
ungarbledInput - A map containing the GarbledWire indices and non garbled value for that index.
allInputWireValues - The map containing both garbled values for each input wire.

Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit

It takes as a parameter a Map that maps the input wire indices to a garbled wire containing the appropriate garbled values.

See #setGarbledInputFromUngarbledInput(File, Map) for an alternate way of setting the input.

Specified by:
setInputs in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Parameters:

verify

public boolean verify(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputWireValues)
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
The verify method is used in the case of malicious adversaries.

Alice constructs n circuits and Bob can verify n-1 of them (of his choice) to confirm that they are indeed garbling of the agreed upon non garbled circuit. In order to verify, Alice has to give Bob both keys for each of the input wires.

Specified by:
verify in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Parameters:
allInputWireValues - A containing both keys for each input wire. For each input wire , the map contains an array of two values. The value in the 0 position is the 0 encoding, and the value in the 1 position is the 1 encoding.
Returns:
true if this GarbledBooleanCircuit is a garbling the given keys, false if it is not.

translate

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Wire> translate(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,GarbledWire> garbledOutput)
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit

Specified by:
translate in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Parameters:
garbledOutput - A Map) that contains the garbled output. This map maps the output wire indices to {@code GarbledWire}s
Returns:
a Map that maps the output wire to ungarbled Wires that are set to either 0 or 1.

verifiedTranslate

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Wire> verifiedTranslate(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,GarbledWire> garbledOutput,
                                                               java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allOutputWireValues)
                                                        throws CheatAttemptException
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
Verifies that the given garbledOutput is valid values according to the given all OutputWireValues.

Meaning, for each output wire, checks that the garbled wire is one of the two possibilities. Then, translates the garbled output obtained from the GarbledBooleanCircuit.compute() function into a meaningful(i.e. 0-1) output.

Specified by:
verifiedTranslate in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Parameters:
garbledOutput - A Map) that contains the garbled output. This map maps the output wire s to {@code GarbledWire}s
allOutputWireValues - both values for each output wire.
Returns:
a Map that maps the output wire indices to ungarbled Wires that are set to either 0 or 1.
Throws:
CheatAttemptException - if there is a garbledOutput values that is not one of the two possibilities.

getGarbledTables

public GarbledTablesHolder getGarbledTables()
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
The garbled tables are stored in the circuit for all the gates. This method returns the garbled tables.

This function is useful if we would like to pass many garbled circuits built on the same boolean circuit.

This is a compact way to define a circuit, that is, two garbled circuit with the same multi encryption scheme and the same basic boolean circuit only differ in the garbled tables and the translation table.

Thus we can hold one garbled circuit for all the circuits and only replace the garbled tables (and the translation tables if necessary). The advantage is that the size of the tables only is much smaller that all the information stored in the circuit (gates and other member variables). The size becomes important when sending large circuits.

Specified by:
getGarbledTables in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit

getTranslationTable

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Byte> getTranslationTable()
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
Returns the translation table of the circuit.

This is necessary since the constructor of the circuit may want to pass the translation table to an other party.

Usually, this will be used when the other party (not the constructor of the circuit) creates a circuit, sets the garbled tables and needs the translation table as well to complete the construction of the circuit.

Specified by:
getTranslationTable in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Returns:
the translation table of the circuit.

setTranslationTable

public void setTranslationTable(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Byte> translationTable)
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
Sets the translation table of the circuit.

This is necessary when the garbled tables where set and we would like to compute the circuit later on.

Specified by:
setTranslationTable in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Parameters:
translationTable - This value should match the garbled tables of the circuit.
